description: Tracks application time to ready for the student iOS client
title: [iOS] Time to Ready

definition.content:
Application Time to Ready represents the time it takes for an authenticated user to be presented with data on the home feed after opening the app. This composes of three pieces: app launch, app set up, and home time to ready.

- App Launch is the time it takes arrive at our first executable line of code application(didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:)
- App set up covers our codepaths to set up the project libraries and fetch the current user session
- Home Time to Ready is how long it takes for the home screen to be interactive and presented with data

Application Time to Ready represents the time it takes for an authenticated user to be presented with data on the home feed after opening the app. This composes of app set up, and home time to ready. This Datadog calculation only shows between app setup and home time to ready. App Launch Times will be in mode (TBD).

- 9.76 seconds is the baseline reported from app version 4.10.0
- 6 seconds is the goal for Q1 2022

There's a bug where we'll ocassionally send some huge numbers to throw everything off whack. The above list normalizes things a bit by removing instances with the avg > 20s. 

Ideally we shouldn't see a wildly large gap between TTR minimums and maximums until we start caching data. 

There's a fix in 4.12.0 that should quell this once its released.

This metric represents the time it takes to fetch the home dashboard data. Generally marks from when the home coordinator starts to when the data state is loaded.

- 6.13 seconds is the baseline reported from app version 4.10.0
- 4 seconds is the goal for Q1 2022
- 1 second is the goal for 2022
Something is sending this off whack in occasion. (See App TTR comment)
Here are the number of events coming in. It ebbs because I turn off a toggle for a previous version in the hopes of stopping the flow of bad data coming in

This metric represents the network request to fetch the home feed as found through custom instrumentation on the mobile client.

This is the GraphQL version of the request we're moving towards and the REST version is the versions of the app prior to 4.10.0
These are the calculations from the same endpoint from the backend perspective for comparison

This captures the overall time it takes to set up the app before the user is presented with any screen. This should be a combination of all the measurements below (loading project libraries, renewing the auth token, fetching the user session and identifying the user in launch darkly)
This metric represents the time it takes for us to load our project libraries from the ConfigManager class.  This is the first major process that runs after the app launches

This metric represents the time it takes for us to renew the user's auth token. Right now the auth token is renewed at the start of every session. 

There seems to be an opportunity here to be smarter on when we renew the auth token
This metric represents the time it takes for the app to fetch the current user session. If there is no authenticated user, this step doesn't run
This metric represents the time it takes for the app to fetch the current user session. If there is no authenticated user, this step doesn't run
These are the fetch user session/renew auth token metrics from the backend perspective for comparison
